title: Contemporary Chicano/a-Latino/a Cultural Production: 1960 to Present
description: Cross-disciplinary study of late twentieth-century Latino/a-Chicano/a literature, the visual and performing arts, film, or other cultural practices. Specific periods covered will fall between the Kennedy years to the era of neoliberalism and the creation of “Hispanic” or Latino identities. May be taken for credit up to two times as topics vary.  Prerequisites:  LTSP 100A or 100B, or consent of instructor.
